articles.headline: Wisconsin Rout Points to Democrats’ Enduring Post-Dobbs Strength
articles.snippet: A resounding victory by a liberal judge who ran on abortion rights showed that a largely unified political left is keeping up its momentum, and served as a new warning sign to Republicans.
articles.abstract: A resounding victory by a liberal judge who ran on abortion rights showed that a largely unified political left is keeping up its momentum, and served as a new warning sign to Republicans.
articles.lead_paragraph: MILWAUKEE — The commanding victory on Tuesday by a liberal candidate in a pivotal race for the Wisconsin Supreme Court showed the enduring power of abortion rights and issues of democracy as motivators for Democratic voters, as well as a continuing struggle among conservatives to put forward candidates who can unite Republicans and win general elections.

articles.headline: Rupert Murdoch Can Be Forced to Testify in Defamation Trial, Judge Says
articles.snippet: Star hosts for Fox News like Tucker Carlson and Sean Hannity may also appear in person at the high-profile trial, which is set to start April 17.
articles.abstract: Star hosts for Fox News like Tucker Carlson and Sean Hannity may also appear in person at the high-profile trial, which is set to start April 17.
articles.lead_paragraph: The witness list for the Fox News $1.6 billion defamation trial now has more big names than a prime-time lineup.

articles.headline: Trump’s Charges Bring Doubts, Hopes and Uncertainty in Both Parties
articles.snippet: To some Republicans and Democrats, the charges appeared flimsy and less consequential than many had hoped. To others, the case had the potential to reverberate politically.
articles.abstract: To some Republicans and Democrats, the charges appeared flimsy and less consequential than many had hoped. To others, the case had the potential to reverberate politically.
articles.lead_paragraph: In an ordinary presidential-primary season, the indictment of a front-runner over hush money paid to a porn star would, at the least, be an opening for rivals to attack. But a day after the arraignment of former President Donald J. Trump on 34 felony counts, one thing was clear: This will not be an ordinary political season.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Weisman, Katie Glueck and Jazmine Ulloa

articles.headline: Zelensky Gets Hero’s Welcome in Poland, Cementing Ukraine’s Ties
articles.snippet: Polish leaders backed Ukraine’s bid for NATO membership, but even without that, Russia’s invasion is making the alliance’s eastern flank more united, and more important.
articles.abstract: Polish leaders backed Ukraine’s bid for NATO membership, but even without that, Russia’s invasion is making the alliance’s eastern flank more united, and more important.
articles.lead_paragraph: Feted as a hero who is saving Europe from Russia’s maw, President Volodymyr Zelensky of Ukraine, on his first official visit to Poland, on Wednesday cemented a new axis of shared interests and military power that is pushing Europe’s center of geopolitical gravity eastward.

articles.headline: Tennessee House Poised to Expel 3 Democrats Over Gun Control Protest
articles.snippet: The Republican-dominated House was set to vote on Thursday on taking the rare and punitive action of removing the Democrats from office for their part in the protest.
articles.abstract: The Republican-dominated House was set to vote on Thursday on taking the rare and punitive action of removing the Democrats from office for their part in the protest.
articles.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — As teenagers and demonstrators flooded the Tennessee state legislature last week to call for lawmakers to toughen access to guns after a deadly shooting at a Christian school, three Democrats headed to the well of the House chamber.

articles.headline: With Russia’s Exit, Norway Becomes Europe’s Energy Champion
articles.snippet: It is now the continent’s largest supplier of natural gas, and last year the country’s energy earnings jumped $100 billion.
articles.abstract: It is now the continent’s largest supplier of natural gas, and last year the country’s energy earnings jumped $100 billion.
articles.lead_paragraph: The new front line for Europe’s energy security is a modest office building overlooking a fjord in Stavanger, Norway. Inside, a company called Petoro oversees three dozen of the largest oil and natural gas fields in Europe, on Norway’s petroleum-rich continental shelf.

articles.headline: Attacks on Dominion Voting Persist Despite High-Profile Lawsuits
articles.snippet: Unproven claims about Dominion Voting Systems still spread widely online.
articles.abstract: Unproven claims about Dominion Voting Systems still spread widely online.
articles.lead_paragraph: With a series of billion-dollar lawsuits, including a $1.6 billion case against Fox News headed to trial this month, Dominion Voting Systems sent a stark warning to anyone spreading falsehoods that the company’s technology contributed to fraud in the 2020 election: Be careful with your words, or you might pay the price.

articles.headline: Chinese Officials Flock to Twitter to Defend TikTok
articles.snippet: The company has tried to distance itself, but the information push shows just how deeply invested Beijing is in its fate.
articles.abstract: The company has tried to distance itself, but the information push shows just how deeply invested Beijing is in its fate.
articles.lead_paragraph: When members of Congress grilled TikTok’s chief executive last month on Capitol Hill, the app’s supporters sprang to its defense online.
articles.byline: By Sapna Maheshwari and Steven Lee Myers

articles.headline: Safety Net Barriers Add to Child Poverty in Immigrant Families
articles.snippet: Both legal immigrants and undocumented parents face hurdles in getting aid. The problem has grown more acute as children of immigrants account for a growing share of young people.
articles.abstract: Both legal immigrants and undocumented parents face hurdles in getting aid. The problem has grown more acute as children of immigrants account for a growing share of young people.
articles.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE — Jacqueline Acevedo is a shy seventh grader who spends long hours at the Baptist church where her father serves as a volunteer pastor after earning a scant wage from his day job selling bread.

articles.headline: In Northern Ireland Town, Painful Memories Lie Beneath a Fragile Peace
articles.snippet: Twenty-five years after the Good Friday Agreement ended an era of bloodshed, this is a moment to celebrate reconciliation across Northern Ireland. But for many, the past is not always easy to leave behind.
articles.abstract: Twenty-five years after the Good Friday Agreement ended an era of bloodshed, this is a moment to celebrate reconciliation across Northern Ireland. But for many, the past is not always easy to leave behind.
articles.lead_paragraph: A few days after a gunman fired multiple shots into a police detective in this busy market town six weeks ago, Pauline Harte’s young son came home and asked her, “Whose side are we on?”

articles.headline: Airbus to Double Production in China as It Moves Ahead With New Orders
articles.snippet: The France-based plane maker announced the agreement despite pressure on Europe from the Biden administration to isolate Beijing.
articles.abstract: The France-based plane maker announced the agreement despite pressure on Europe from the Biden administration to isolate Beijing.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Airbus agreed on Thursday to build a second assembly line at its factory in China and was given a green light by Beijing to move ahead with 160 previously announced plane orders. The announcement was a pointed reminder of how China remains a critical market for European companies, even as American manufacturers are pulling up stakes.
